DOC.HEAD: New Bedford, Mass., Salvation Army Shuts Its Doors
DOC.TEXT: The Salvation Army in this southeastern Massachusetts city has closed its doors because it has run out of money, because of what officials said was an sharp increase of people seeking aid. ``We've gone into using the canned food we had put aside for January and February,'' Maj. Robert Pfeiffer, who runs the office, said Thursday. Pfeiffer blamed local unemployment for bringing 1,600 families to the office in the past year _ 300 more than last year. There have been about 1,000 layoffs in the area in the last month, he said. Pfeiffer said he didn't know when the office will reopen, but he said he expects the doors to remain closed just through the Christmas season. When he closed the doors at 2 p.m. Thursday, there were still about 100 people waiting for help. ``We're going to help them, but at this point, we can't take any more,'' he said.
